messages.subject: Re: Music Theory
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/22/99 11:20:33 PM EST, shantinik@earthlink.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/22/99 11:20:33 PM EST, shantinik@... writes:

<< she
asked us to look for a computer program that deals with music theory.
Anyone have any experience in this realm? >>
David,
I will ask the teachers at the music school where the boys go. A lot of the
teachers are in school themselves, and probably know some good ones. It will
probably be Tuesday before I can find out as their next band is Mon. night.
Teresa

messages.subject: Re: Music Theory
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks! David ... -- Joseph Chilton Pearce calls And the Skylark Sings with Me: Adventures in Homeschooling and Community-Based Education the definitive

David

messages.subject: Re: Music Theory
messages.msgSnippet: Hi there David, Here is a site that  my daughter has enjoyed. It was developed by a musician and academic from Nova Scotia. I hope that you enjoy it.
messages.messageBody:
Hi there David,

Here is a site that my daughter has enjoyed. It was developed by a
musician and academic from Nova Scotia. I hope that you enjoy it.

www.musictheory.halifax.ns.ca/1gs.html
please note;(that is a 'one' before the gs)

Brooke


>So, being that she loves the computer almost as much as the piano, she
>asked us to look for a computer program that deals with music theory.
>Anyone have any experience in this realm?
>
>Help appreciated. Thanks!
>
>David Albert
>

brynlee@...

messages.subject: Music Theory
messages.msgSnippet: ... So, being that she loves the computer almost as much as the piano, she asked us to look for a computer program that deals with music theory. Anyone have
messages.messageBody:
> Here's a call for help. My 9-year-old is a very gifted pianist
> (unlike my 11-year-old, she is not particularly gifted
> intellectually.) She can sightread Mozart, Bach, Gershwin, whatever
> we (or her teacher puts in front of her.) She understands key
> signatures, rhythms, accidentals, etc. and uses them fluently in her
> playing, but retains virtually none of this theoretical information
> off the keyboard. (which frustrates her some when she wants to have
> conversations about it.)

So, being that she loves the computer almost as much as the piano, she
asked us to look for a computer program that deals with music theory.
Anyone have any experience in this realm?

Help appreciated. Thanks!

David Albert

--
Joseph Chilton Pearce calls "And the Skylark Sings with Me: Adventures
